instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: client brought in a 15" late 2013, powers on but does not finish booting from any drive, os, or even safe mode.  so first i tried re-soldering <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> and changing <CAPACITOR>C9364</CAPACITOR> 330 uf poly-tant cap but the new replacements i had were a little too tall and couldn't properly under heatsink, but i tried :(. when i would power on it would chime and display image and then short off a few seconds later and auto reboot.  this got progressively worse and shorter after a few times.  so i put back the original cap and moved the <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> from another board but it's still pretty much doing same thing, chiming then shorting out real quick now and now there is no image at all. did i fuck it up really bad? also left fan was bad, maybe that contributed to original failure? i see the early 2013 its usually that ISL controller solder but is it GPU on these ones? cuz I don't have a bga machine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not booting
threads.message: Probably the usual 3662/3787 problem. No solution is known to me at this time.
